todaysEvents.title: China-linked Linux-based Malware Breach at Southeastern Europe Telecom Providers
todaysEvents.description: A China-linked threat actor using Linux-based malware has breached telecommunications providers in Southeastern Europe by exploiting edge devices.

todaysEvents.title: Truebit Protocol $26M ETH Exploit
todaysEvents.description: Truebit protocol confirmed a security incident involving an exploit that drained over $26 million in ETH.

todaysEvents.title: Qilin Group Breach of Anteriad (3TB Data Exfiltration)
todaysEvents.description: The Qilin hacking group claims to have breached US-based company Anteriad, allegedly exfiltrating 3.0 TB of data.

todaysEvents.title: Qilin Group Breach of Softlab SpA
todaysEvents.description: The Qilin hacking group claims to have breached Italian ICT company Softlab SpA.

todaysEvents.title: ChatGPT & DeepSeek Vulnerabilities and Malicious AI Extension Leaks
todaysEvents.description: New vulnerabilities in ChatGPT and malicious Chrome extensions posing as AI tools have been discovered, allegedly spying on over 1 million users and exfiltrating sensitive conversation data.

todaysEvents.title: Cisco ISE Patch for Public Exploit
todaysEvents.description: Cisco has patched a vulnerability in its Identity Service Engine (ISE) and warned of public proof-of-concept exploit code available for use by authenticated attackers.

todaysEvents.title: Salt Typhoon Cyber Espionage Campaign
todaysEvents.description: A massive cyber espionage campaign known as Salt Typhoon, attributed to Beijing's intelligence service, has been identified in a series of recent attacks.

todaysEvents.title: HPE OneView Maximum Severity Vulnerability Exploitation
todaysEvents.description: CISA flagged a maximum severity vulnerability in HPE OneView that is being actively exploited in attacks.

todaysEvents.title: Smaregi Breach and Leak of 100,000 Customer Records
todaysEvents.description: The lulzintel threat actor claims to have breached Japanese company Smaregi, allegedly leaking a database containing personal information of 100,000 customers.

todaysEvents.title: GoBruteforcer Attacks on Crypto/Blockchain Projects
todaysEvents.description: A new wave of GoBruteforcer attacks is targeting cryptocurrency and blockchain projects.

past7Days.briefing: This week witnessed a dramatic escalation in cyber threats across multiple sectors—finance, technology, healthcare, telecommunications, and AI. High-severity breaches, exploits, and data leaks dominated the landscape, with attacks targeting crypto wallets, financial institutions, major retail chains, and telecom providers. Notably, threat actors such as Qilin, Salt Typhoon, and other nation-state linked groups executed coordinated campaigns, resulting in multi-million dollar losses, massive data exfiltration (some exceeding terabytes), and exposure of sensitive customer and business information worldwide. The proliferation of sophisticated social engineering, phishing, and malware campaigns—often leveraging current vulnerabilities and trusted platforms (e.g., MetaMask, Trust Wallet, ChatGPT)—has compounded risks for both organizations and individuals. The overall threat level remains critically high, with ongoing exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities, advanced persistent threats, and highly targeted attacks on digital assets and infrastructure.
past7Days.trends: Several clear patterns have emerged: (1) Cryptocurrency and blockchain platforms are under sustained attack, with wallet-draining exploits, multi-signature wallet breaches, and targeted scams continuing unabated—totaling over $80M in reported losses. (2) Nation-state actors, particularly China-linked groups, are increasingly active, focusing on telecom and espionage campaigns (Salt Typhoon), exploiting edge devices and Linux-based malware. (3) Large-scale data exfiltration and leaks from both corporate and consumer platforms are rising, with threat groups like Qilin breaching healthcare, retail, ICT, and marketing companies. (4) Social engineering and phishing is growing more sophisticated, often exploiting trusted brands (MetaMask, Ledger, Chrome extensions, ChatGPT) and leveraging topical themes (New Year, fake 2FA flows). (5) Vulnerabilities in widely deployed software (Cisco ISE, HPE OneView, Next.js, AI platforms) are being rapidly weaponized, with public exploit code circulating and active exploitation confirmed. (6) There is an uptick in fraud techniques—such as NFC payment fraud via Ghost Tap malware—and deceptive malware delivery (fake BSOD screens).
past7Days.predictions: Expect continued high-frequency, high-impact attacks targeting cryptocurrency and blockchain projects, with more wallet-draining exploits and large-scale thefts likely. Nation-state activity, especially from China-linked actors, will remain elevated, focusing on telecoms, critical infrastructure, and supply chain partners. Data breaches and leaks—especially involving AI platforms, financial institutions, and healthcare—will persist, with new vulnerabilities and exploit kits rapidly adopted by both criminal and APT groups. Social engineering and phishing attacks will become increasingly convincing, targeting both organizations and end-users through trusted channels and emerging technologies. Fraud, especially in payment systems (NFC, mobile wallets), will spike further as attackers refine techniques. Confidence Level: High—these predictions are based on clear, recent escalation and broad actor activity, supported by global news of increased ransomware, espionage, and exploit-driven campaigns in early 2026. Organizations should prioritize patching, incident response readiness, user awareness, and crypto asset protection over the coming days.
